DataTypes_Array_key1: Think about a list of your favourite things.
DataTypes_Array_key7: Now imagine you had to store them together as myFavourtiThings in JS. To do this you will use an Array Data Type.
DataTypes_Array_key8: An array is a type of object used for storing multiple values in a single variable.
DataTypes_Array_key9: The simplest way to create an array is by specifying the array elements as a comma-separated list enclosed by square brackets, as shown in the example below:
DataTypes_Array_key10: Each value (also called an element) in an array has a numeric position, known as its index, and it may contain data of any data type-numbers, strings, booleans, functions, objects, and even other arrays. The array index starts from 0, so that the first array element is arr[0] not arr[1].
DataTypes_Array_key11: For the example above, cities[0] refers to Dharamshala.
